action.action-desc: Mr. Ruiz (for himself, Mr. Cartwright, Ms. Brownley of California, Mr. Garamendi, Mr. Swalwell of California, and Ms. Sinema) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To authorize appropriations for the SelectUSA Initiative, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Get Reinvesting in Opportunities for Workers (GROW) American Jobs Act .
In this Act, the term SelectUSA Initiative means the SelectUSA Initiative established by Executive Order 13577 of June 15, 2011.

section.header: Authorization of appropriations for the SelectUSA initiative
section.text: There is authorized to be appropriated for the SelectUSA Initiative $20,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2016 through 2020.

The Secretary of Commerce shall, not later than December 31 of 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, and 2020, submit to Congress a report on the activities of the SelectUSA Initiative during the preceding fiscal year. Each such report shall include the following:

paragraph.text: The grantees and projects to which assistance was provided under the SelectUSA Initiative during the preceding fiscal year, and the amount and type of assistance provided to each such grantee and project.
The number of foreign firms that relocated to the United States during the preceding fiscal year as a result of the activities of the SelectUSA Initiative.
Any findings that are made by the SelectUSA Initiative in conducting its activities and are relevant to promoting the United States as a destination for the location of manufacturing.
